tags: pokemon volcanion and the mechanical marvel
summary: I finally got around to watching “Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel” and now I can’t stop laughing because somehow despite...
body:
I finally got around to watching “Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel” and now I can’t stop laughing because somehow

despite being attached to a Legendary Pokemon

a Pokemon that could literally blow up mountains

prone to hot water explosions

and with a temper to match

and getting flung around by jets of scalding water from said Pokemon and then being yanked back

this is one movie out of few where Ash doesn’t die.

blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Furfrou
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Furfrou
body:
676: Furfrou

Now Gen 6′s ready to smack us with good critter after good critter. A lot like how Unova had its obligatory Eagle Pokemon, here’s a poodle for France. Yeah, that’s super predictable for a region so blatantly based around France, even to a point where its name is based on “frou frou”. But I think this is at least it done in a correct way. It could’ve just been a boring ol Normal-type poodle Pokemon with maybe a baby stage and move on. It can be this generation’s “Stoutland” and we’d leave it at that. But something sings to be about Furfrou.

And hell, out of the plenty of regular dog-Pokemon we’ve gotten, I’d go so far as to say Furfrou is easily my favorite. I just like its funky little cartoon dog face, and crazily fluffy but unruly hair. Something about that alone gets to me in just the right ways. But even though Furfrou is among the early-game Pokemon, it’s actually plenty usable! It may not exactly be out-performing stuff like Garchomp but its ability of Fur Coat actually gives it quite an edge with how it halves any physical damage it takes. Just keep it away from heavy Special Attackers and this thing can actually surprisingly hold its own pretty well up into the endgame.

But of course, that’s not everything to Furfrou! It also comes with a fun little gimmick. It’s only cosmetic changes, but it’s a good bit into why I’d say this is pulling off the “stereotype animal” for the region better than Braviary or Comfey have.

Furfrou, being the poodle that it is, is known for being a showy dog that gets its fur fixed up in a particularly dressy way. Thus, we get these nine extra haircuts for Furfrou. I’ll forego reviewing all of them, and just go with saying my favorites are the Pharaoh, Kabuki, and Debutante trims. Though, in the end, I do like the unruly base form the most out of all of them. But I still find it cool that you can change your poodle’s haircut around, and that it’ll even lose it over time. Just a shame there’s no gameplay effect each one has. I would’ve taken something like a type or ability change for each form, but oh well.

Overall: 9.5/10

Maybe not overly clever, but still a really good dog!!!

[Archive]

reblog.comment:
[[MORE]]

tags: one of the purest interactions i ever had
summary: one of my favorite pokémon memories wasn't even when i was playing. i was at the children's hospital since my brother had cancer...
body:
one of my favorite pokémon memories wasn’t even when i was playing. i was at the children’s hospital since my brother had cancer and there was a games room where you could loan for an hour or two game systems. i had brought my own ds and this little kid of like 6 years old just waddled up to me and shyly asked me if i knew how to catch pokémon (he was in the oreburgh mine in diamond) and so we encountered an onix and just like those annoying npcs, i taught him how to weaken a pokémon and caught it. we then played together quietly side-by-side until i had to leave

i still think about it everytime i play

blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Neapolabsol Absol and Neapolitan Ice-Cream fusion Nutritional Information: Dairy/Sugar Type Ability: Ice Body Signature Move:...
caption:
Neapolabsol

Absol and Neapolitan Ice-Cream fusion

Nutritional Information:

Dairy/Sugar Type

Ability: Ice Body

Signature Move: Frozen Prison - The Pokefood encapsulates its opponent in ice-cream, slowly damaging the opponent each turn.  Damages the opponent each turn for 3-8 turns. Has a 20% chance to freeze the opponent.  This chance increases to 40% after 4 turns. Dairy Type.

The Ice-Cream Disaster Pokefood

Neapolabsol helps to detect impurities in ice-cream and can detect if there will be a problem in the ice-cream making process. It needs to be kept in a cool place as it will start to melt in hot temperatures and loose its abilities. When it runs, the sweet scent of strawberry, vanilla and chocolate follows.

Day 3 of the Halloween event and we have a Absol fused with Neapolitan Ice-cream suggested by @cr-tist.  I had so much fun making this!

blog.name: cyndakip
blog.title: The future is now, thanks to science!
blog.description: Hi I'm Cyndakip and I write nuzlockes!

summary: Our tickets are taken with a smile, and we‘re waved onwards. I gaze curiously down into the ever-shifting water beneath us as we...
body:
Our tickets are taken with a smile, and we‘re waved onwards. I gaze curiously down into the ever-shifting water beneath us as we walk up the gangplank. I may be afraid of a lot of things, but the ocean isn’t one of them, thankfully.


It’s party time! Chapter 13 of The Scientist is here!

It’s party time! Chapter 13 of The Scientist is here!
trail.content:
Our tickets are taken with a smile, and we‘re waved onwards. I gaze curiously down into the ever-shifting water beneath us as we walk up the gangplank. I may be afraid of a lot of things, but the ocean isn’t one of them, thankfully.


It’s party time! Chapter 13 of The Scientist is here!

summary: Oh yeah we all love Rotom n shit
body:
Oh yeah we all love Rotom n shit

Do do you know how fucking terrifying it was getting them???

An abandoned old chateau where there were FUCKING GHOSTS OF A LITTLE GIRL AND OLD MAN fucking PHASING THRU WALLS AND DISSAPEARING N SHIT

Then you find a tv that for some reason is permanently stuck playing static and that’s where u find the lil bastard

Every generation has a creepy ass place or places but for me Platinum was my first game & I’m still wary of that orange punk

blog.name: relichunter2000
blog.title: Number 15: Burger King Foot Lettuce
blog.description: The last thing you'd want in your Burger King burger is someone's foot fungus. But as it turns out, that might be what you get.
